page.title: 14Religion in Colton
page.content: St.Paul's Colton is ministered by Rev. Francis A.R. Minay and is a daughter church of All Saints, Bolton Percy.The only service is a Family Communion once a month on Sundays at 9 a.m. The church is used for christenings and burials but not weddings.St.Paul's is a simple rectangular structure of brick,with a tiled roof and a small bell-tower faced with slates.The ceiling is made of wooden boards and there is a tiny vestry on the North side which houses the bell rope.The East Window of 5 lights depicting the Nativity is dedicated to Ethel Lawson -Smith.Other memorials are to Robert J.Crosthwaite,Edward M.Lawson-Smith and the seven who died in 1914-18. There is a harmonium,piano,and seating for 72.Built in 1899, it commemorates the Diamond Jubilee.The estimated cost was Â£920, Lawson-Smiths gave Â£250.
